intro: Myosotis sibirica, commonly known as Siberian forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and parts of Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, sky-blue to violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the stems are slender and often branched. Myosotis sibirica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
